data.title: Pau Gasol Biography
data.meta_description: Read all about Pau Gasol with TV Guide's exclusive biography including their list of awards, celeb facts and more at TV Guide.
data.text:
Fast Facts

Both his parents played second-division basketball in Spain

Maintenance staff at his school had to build a special desk for him because he was too tall

Planned to become a doctor, but dropped out of med school after a year to pursue basketball

Drafted third by the Atlanta Hawks in 2001, but was traded to the Memphis Grizzlies, where he played for seven years before being traded to the L

A

Lakers in 2008

Won the NBA Rookie of the Year award in 2002

Has won two NBA Championships (2009, 2010) and three Olympic medals with Spain (silvers in 2008 and 2012; bronze in 2016)

Has worn the same jersey number (#16) for both Memphis and L

A

Joined the Hoops for St

Jude charity program in 2009

The charity benefits the St

Jude Children's Research Hospital

Speaks English, Catalan and Spanish fluently, and is nearly fluent in Italian and French
